Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
drugged
(Or "on drugs") 1. Conspicuously stupid, heading toward {brain-damaged}. Often accompanied by a pantomime of toking a joint.
2. Of hardware, very slow relative to normal performance.
[{Jargon File}]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
drugged \drugged\ adj. under the influence of narcotics or hypnotic drugs.
Syn: doped, narcotized. [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Drug \Drug\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Drugged}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Drugging}.] [Cf. F. droguer.] To prescribe or administer drugs or medicines. --B. Jonson. [1913 Webster]
drugged adj. (also `on drugs') 1. Conspicuously stupid, heading toward {brain-damaged}. Often accompanied by a pantomime of toking a joint. 2. Of hardware, very slow relative to normal performance.

drug n : a substance that is used as a medicine or narcotic v 1: administer a drug to; "They drugged the kidnapped tourist" [syn: {dose}] 2: use recreational drugs [syn: {do drugs}] [also: {drugging}, {drugged}]

drugged adj : under the influence of narcotics; "knocked out by doped wine"; "a drugged sleep"; "were under the effect of the drugged sweets"; "in a narcotized state; stuperous" [syn: {doped}, {narcotized}, {narcotised}]
